definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Kuomintang/same as 孫中山|孙中山
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
to escape/leisurely/outstanding
variant of 仙[xian1]
immortal

sentences.english: Dr. Sun Yat-sen led the Chinese people to a free country.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙博士带领中国人民迈向自由。

sentences.english: Dr. Sun Yat-sen was born on that day.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙博士出生在那天。

sentences.english: The republic an revolution of 1911 led by Dr Sun Yat-sen.
sentences.chinese: 始于孙逸仙博士领导的辛亥革命。

sentences.english: Confucius was as great as any teacher that ever lived in China.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙博士是中国曾经有过的最伟大的领袖。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen and Chen Jiongming soon split over the continuation of the Northern Expedition.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙和陈炯明不久就因继续北伐的事宜而分道扬镳。

sentences.english: B:The Dr.Sun Yi Xian Memorial Hall.We'll send a car to pick you up at three.
sentences.chinese: 在孙逸仙博士纪念馆，我们3点会派车去接你。

definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
Revive China Society, founded by Dr Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山 in 1894 in Honolulu
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Borodin (name)/Alexander Porfirevich Borodin (1833-1887), Russian chemist and composer
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
father or founder of a nation/Father of the Republic (Sun Yat-sen)
Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People (late 1890s)
